definition: variant of 屬相|属相[shu3 xiang4]
category/genus (taxonomy)/family members/dependents/to belong to/subordinate to/affiliated with/be born in the year of (one of the 12 animals)/to be/to prove to be/to constitute
to join together/to fix one's attention on/to concentrate on
elephant/CL:隻|只[zhi1]/shape/form/appearance/to imitate
colloquial term for 生肖[sheng1 xiao4] the animals associated with the years of a 12-year cycle
the 12 earthly branches 子[zi3], 丑, 寅, 卯, 辰, 巳, 午, 未, 申, 酉, 戌, 亥 (used cyclically in the calendar and as ordinal numbers)
lunar calendar
casting a couple's fortune based on their bithdates (old)
Year 4, year of the Rabbit (e.g. 2011)
11th earthly branch: 7-9 p.m., 9th solar month (8th October-6th November), year of the Dog/ancient Chinese compass point: 300°
see 屈戌兒|屈戌儿[qu1 qu5 er5]
the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1] and twelve earthly branches 十二枝/sexagenary cycle
the character 8 or 八/birthdate characters used in fortune-telling
good and bad luck (in astrology)
thirtieth year J6 of the 60 year cycle, e.g. 2013 or 2073
twenty-ninth year I5 of the 60 year cycle, e.g. 2012 or 2072
Year 2, year of the Bull or Ox (e.g. 2009)
the 12 earthly branches 子[zi3], 丑[chou3], 寅[yin2], 卯[mao3], 辰[chen2], 巳[si4], 午[wu3], 未[wei4], 申[shen1], 酉[you3], 戌[xu1], 亥[hai4], used cyclically in the calendar and as ordinal numbers I, II etc
Year of the Boar (e.g. 2007)
twenty-fifth year E1 of the 60 year cycle, e.g. 2008 or 2068
sixtieth year J12 of the 60 year cycle, e.g. 1983 or 2043
